alert.note: Alert for Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 7:52PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Powder River County through 830 PM MDT... At 749 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms over portions of east central Powder River county, with the strongest storm 9 miles southeast of Broadus, along Highway 212, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail, winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broadus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
